intro: Popowia dicranantha, commonly known as the small-leaf popowia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as forests and understoreys. Popowia dicranantha is often found in association with other understory plants, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
